intro: Gynochthodes podistra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock-heath, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant features small, dark green leaves that are often arranged in a whorled pattern along the stems. Its flowers are typically pink or white, appearing in clusters and blooming during the spring and early summer. Gynochthodes podistra thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
